name: Rack Carry
setup: Clean kettlebells to rack position at shoulders
Elbows down, bells resting on forearms/chest
steps: Begin walking with controlled, short steps
Keep kettlebells stable in rack position
Complete distance/time, then safely lower bells
cues: Bells rest on body, not in hands
mistakes: Supporting bells with grip instead of rack
Leaning back to counterbalance front load
Holding breath due to front loading
safety: Master kettlebell rack position before walking. Start light to adapt to front loading.

prescriptionHints.notes: Front-loaded carry challenges posture and breathing

joints.notes: Proper rack position essential. Bells rest on body, not held by grip.
